alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 7:50PM CDT until May 19 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road affecting Fort Bend and Harris Counties. San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Colorado, Fort Bend, Austin and Wharton Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Boling affecting Brazoria, Fort Bend and Wharton Counties. For the Cypress Creek...including Eldridge Parkway, Mathis Road, Sharp Road, Katy-Hockley Road, Hufmeister Road, Grant Road, Kohrville, Stuebner-Airline Road, Westfield, Kuykendahl Road, Cypresswood Drive, Inverness Forest...Minor flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads along the river inundated. Backwater flooding up Britt Branch and Bratcher Slough begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Thursday was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 12.7 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.1 feet on 04/02/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 17.1 Thu 7 pm CDT 16.3 15.8 14.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 100 PM CDT.
